caption: Really tasty pizza. Great crust and sauce. Will definitely order again.

I was in town for two days and wanted a true Chicago pizza experience.  Vinny's Pizza, located underneath the railroad tracks going into Union Station, sounded perfect.  I was expecting a real dive.  When I walked in I almost didn't stay because the place is so nice.  But Jackson the bartender immediately greeted me and made me feel welcome.  When he found out that I was a tourist, he kicked in to tour guide mode and suggested several places for me to visit. The chopped salad was great and the pizza was excellent!  The service was superb and the prices were on par.  I highly recommend Vinny's!

Vinny's is connected to Ogilvie so it's a solid spot to drop into if you have some time to kill before or after a Metra ride. On my two visits (both for lunch) the place was pretty empty, so a wait time isn't something to worry about. That said, service was extremely, extremely slow both times. There was only one person working the whole restaurant, which when it's not busy, I understand, but there still needs to be attentiveness - especially when drinks go dry.  I did have the chance to meet the chef on my first visit, though, and he was gracious and friendly! He explained some of the restaurant's pizza-making processes and was genuinely a super fun guy to talk to.  The pizza is pretty tasty; I've had it twice and was happy on both occasions.  I had the margherita and the cheese pizza pie loaded with veggies. The prices are a little higher than an average lunch spot, though. An Italian beef sandwich or chicken parm will set you back $14. Without tax or tip.
Nice happy hour restaurant/bar at the train station.
Great bar service, food is alright too.
Nice selection of menu and delicious pizza with cold drinks for happy hour. can't complain on their location at the ogilvie Metra station.
Great place and staff
Awesome spot for post work drinks and pizza. Accommodating and close to the train. Beer selection is on point.

This is a great place. Great food and drinks. The music and decorations are modern and thoughtful. The bartender April was so personable, friendly and still professional.. I did not have the pizza, which I heard is great from the other customers... But I had the Caprese with Chicken. Great flavors. Definitely coming back here soon.
Great service. Fun music ... and sports. What's not to like.

The pizza here was just ok.  I will say that they had some odd topping options (like salmon or tuna-can't remember which).  If you are looking for a pizza fix it is a fine place to stop in and visit.  Staff was nice, service was good, and drinks were priced reasonably. Also looks like a good place to watch sports as lots of tvs
They have some really good pizza. BBQ chicken and bacon is awesome, giardenara is spicy and the pepperoni is a classic
Nice and quick service..just what i need to unwind after a long day of work
Great service.  Pizza was fantastic.
Decent affordable bar atmosphere. Service was only a little slow today!

If i could rate them higher i would. Best pizza and cheese sticks ive ever had. The whole staff was amazing but our waitress the hostess and the GM have to b some of the nicest people ive ever met. They found out it was my son vinnys bday so we walked outta there with free drinks and awesome cake and a vinnys pizza bar staff shirt for my son. And id say the prices were reasonable for downtown but honestly they were reasonable for anywhere. We had a large pizza meatball sub pasta salad cheese sticks and calamari and our bill was $50. I expected it to b double that down town. Overall experience was absolutely incredible.
Vinny's should hire one additional server during PM happy hour to reduce wait time. The food and drinks are great!
Great

Local bar close to work. It's a fine place to drink but wouldn't totally recommend the food. Pizza and breadsticks are fine if you're really hungry. Calamari was actually pretty good. Jill the bartender is the real reason we go - she's great! Wish they stayed open past 10
Great Pizza
I’m from NJ/NY so I’m a harsh critic of pizza. This is quite literally the best pizza I’ve ever had in my life.
Delish
Kinda pricey if you ask me, I’ve tried it before but decided to give another shot.

Your standard run off the mill after work happy hour spot. Decent selection of beer, good food, gets crowded right after work then empties it once everyone needs to catch their train home from Ogilvie.
They charge you tax for alcohol. Which has already been taxed and is a scam. Expensive beers on top of it
Nice ambiance. Nasty food. Taste like frozen pizza
Great pizza.. and the calamari is awesome
(Translated by Google) Great pizza  (Original) Buenisimas pizza

The pizza here is pretty good.  Service was a little slow, though, especially since we had a party of 6 and were 80% of the patrons during a slow lunch hour.  If you need a quick slice on the way to/from the train, this has a good location right under the Ogilvie tracks.  Can't comment on the drink specials, but they appear to be decent.
Service was really good and the pizza was great! My second time there nice break before catching the Metra.
Great service.
If you're looking for a welcoming, low-key place to grab drinks after work, check out Vinny's. Friendly servers, yummy pizza and a great happy hour from 3-6pm.
Mozzarella and hot giardiniera pizza. #heaven

I will not be returning to this establishment. Truly horrible customer service, especially considering the mediocre food that I was served. I will be reporting my complaint in depth to the BBB. I was planning on hosting another function at this restaurant initially, but this restaurant will never receive my service again. I wish I could have given them zero stars.
A bang for your buck for sure. Relative to other pizza spots in the area, you get your moneys worth.  Thin crust with a super delicious yeasty crust. It's an awesome lunch spot.
Good service and decent lunch food for the area

I don't think this place is ready for lunch offering yet. Our team (4 people) headed out for the French market and found out this pizza place so we decided to give it a try. Menu looked OK so we all ordered individual pizzas. We waited for more than 30 minutes, but there was no sign of pizza coming. That hit our threshold. It was ridiculous we have to wait for 30 minutes for food during lunch time. I am not sure how good the foods would be because we left without eating, but it didn't meet our critical time requirement. We went back to the French market and it took only 30 minutes from ordering to finishing eating. One of our team members missed his meeting due to this delay. We will never waste time with this place again.

Only reason there is four stars instead of five is once the waitress[Kelly] realized that my co-worker was paying she treated me as if i was a homeless person begging for food. Diversity is here and how you treat someone should not be based on skin color or who is paying. It should be based upon them being a human being not to mention they are part customer and honestly how do you know i could've been the one being treated because i helped the person paying prior and possibly referring my colleagues to be spending way more the next time based on my initial experience. Thanks Kelly for pre-judging. But the food was good all in all. The place is great but like Starbucks I think eveyone/company should have some sort of ethical training (sad to say it's needed anywhere)
Pizza is very nice but they close kitchen early

In between long distance trains and wanted some good pizza. Stopped at Vinny's. Glad I did. Huge fresh Ceasar salad (enough for two) and a really good Margherita pizza. Pizza spot on and I loved the sauce!
The food is amazing! Bread sticks are great. So is the chicken parm! Denise and Linds are two of the better bartenders there. Go stop by and see them!
Nice ambience, food and service.  I saw the lady paying goods attention to all the guests with lots of natural smile on her face, making each quite comfortable.

This place is a must. We came in at the mid afternoon lull and had awesome service! Amazing pizza (which was bigger than we thought) and good (short lists) beer and whiskey selection. The house salad was perfect and just right for 2 people to share. The atmosphere balances dive bar aesthetics with class and oldies hits. The bathrooms are big and nice ( huge plus).
Good tap selection and great pizza.
Ray is the man! Wonderful place to grab a quick after work drink, not pretentious and the staff / guests are very kind -  I’ll be back soon!

Great place to stop in for lunch away from the crush of people in the French market. Prosciutto pizza was excellent and thin-crust, Neapolitan-style with fresh ingredients. Service was friendly and efficient, good beer selection as well. Quirky vibe and appealing interior design. Absolutely recommended.
I wanted to live this place really badly, but they never really got lunch down.  Under staffed and now not even doing lunch anymore.  Plenty of other good enough bars around...
Can for happy hour with  group of 6 friends.  They had a big table right in front of 3 tv's.  Love the pizza and the dipping sauce.  They give you dipping sauce for the crust.
why aren't you open for lunch?!?!

The chairs at the bar were uncomfortable. I kept sliding off them. There's no place to put your feet. Then after I ordered a beer, I found out there's no food there! Don't call it a pizza bar if you're not going to serve food! This place sucks.
Nice spot with friendly staff and great tasting pizza!
Very good train station with a huge food court and CVS pharmacy.
Lovely space. Friendly staff. But more importantly they do a really great pizza on the con side its a little bit pricey bit still worth a visit.
Ray and Lynndie are most excellent hosts. Best music by Yesenia has the best music track east of the Willamette.
